name: Hotel Estherea

reviews.text: Will never get another star as the hotel does not have a full time restaurant. That said, try 'Bert's' on the corner for breakfast or lunch. Fast and cheap. As for the hotel, have been some changes in the last several years since we visited. All good. A new section in the back with its own (new) elevator is a big improvement. The hotel lobby, parlor and library are all clean, well maintained gathering places. There is a small niche bar just off the lobby. The restaurant has been expanded. Our internet rate, which was quite good, did not include breakfast which would have been an 18 euro add-on. See the comment about Bert's. Our room, in the new section, was very nice, well appointed, comfortable bed. The hotel is on the Singel Canal, just a short walk from the Dam, or really anywhere as the tram stop is in the next block. Employees all spoke excellent English (Dutch) and were most helpful. Can't complain, except that they need another star.
reviews.title: needs another star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I chose this hotel based on its great tripadvisor reviews! Since we were only staying in town for a few nights we decided to splurge on the canal facing room because we wanted to wake up every morning and look out on the beautiful canal. We arrived at the hotel at around noon and were told that our room would be ready in an hour, so we stored our luggage and headed out for lunch. When we returned we were given a room, when we arrived in the room it was beautiful and I loved it, but when we looked out the window... no canal view... so we pulled up our reservation just to be sure that we ordered a canal view and sure enough we had so we headed downstairs to talk to the front desk. It turns out there was some sort of booking error and for some reason it said that we had booked a room for 3 and since they dont have any canal facing room for 3 they gave us an alternate room but the fact of the matter was that there were only two of us! So after looking through the reservation system for a while the woman at the front desk let us know that there was unfortunately no canal view room available! Bummer! However she was willing to upgrade us to their luxury suite AND offer us free breakfast AND free wifi for our entire stay! To be honest at first we were still a little upset, we really did want to have a canal facing room even if it was not the luxury suite but when we were shown into the luxury suite our opinion changed. The room was stunning! It was beautifully decorated with a giant chandelier in the middle of the room, I loved it and it was by far the best room that I have ever stayed in! The breakfast was really great, there were a ton of options and it really tasted great! The lobby and bar area are beautiful and great places to just hang out and get a drink. Overall the service made this hotel, they really worked hard to make things right for us! One morning we decided to bike to a windmill that we thought would be about a 20 or 30 minute bike ride away, luckily we checked with the front desk before heading out and she told us that it would probably take us 45 minutes to an hour each way and instead showed us the way to another windmill close by that is also a brewery! It was very cool! The location of this hotel is really amazing! There is a bike rental place orangebike like a block away where you can rent bikes by the day, so this hotel served as the perfect home base for us. I would love to stay at this hotel the next time I am in Amsterdam, and I would even be willing to pay for the upgrade to the luxury suite!
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel, Amazing Service!
Great location, high price
reviews.text: The hotel was located in a great part of the city, away from crowds but close to everything. The prices were pretty high and included just the room, no breakfast, no wifi. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a junior suite but our room was very dark with only one window on the inside of the hotel. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. However, I would think you could find more for your money.
Thanks a lot to all fellow reviewers, who gave us a great recommendation to stay at Estheria, first of all!
reviews.title: Nice, nice, nice!

reviews.text: We spent 3 nights there before our cruise and were just happy. Our room for three on the third floor did not have a view, but was lovely. The third bed for our daughter was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Very original!! Great decoration!

reviews.text: We stayed here for a long weekend at the end of January. Although I had read the reviews I was still a little nervous about the hotel, however upon arrival I was really pleasantly surprised. We arrived to a typical Amsterdam street, narrow with a canal and our hotel was a couple of the traditional houses converted. The reception staff were really friendly and we were upgraded to a deluxe room. Our room was lovely (room 216) with a lovely view overlooking the canal. It was immaculately clean, spacious with a extra large bathroom. If you a planning on staying I would recommend that you upgrade to a deluxe room and if possible ask for this room as our friends who were also staying in a deluxe room didn't get such a nice room - again overlooking the canal but not as large and a small bathroom. Another thing which I really liked was the bed linen, nice fluffy pillows and a lovely duvet, no horrible blankets.
reviews.title: Gem of a Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was building work going on whilst we were staying however it didn't affect our stay. The location of this hotel is perfect. Literally just around the corner from Dam Square. I would definitely return to Amsterdam and to this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel in a very good location. Book a room with a balcony and view to the Gracht.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

likes.disliked: — The building work that was going on

reviews.text: Hotel was lovely. Staff were friendly and willing to help even when we complained about some building work that was going on they were very apologetic and even gave us a night free. The hotel is a short walk from the city centre so the location is ideal. The free hot drinks and biscuits was a really nice touch especially when you come in from the cold. All in all I would definately recommend staying here if you are thinking about going to Amsterdam
reviews.title: We Loved It!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a beautiful view of the Singel Canal from our room.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on a short break before Christmas. We have 3 kids under 10 and we had a "family" room that was really 2 rooms that joined behind a common door. It was great for us because it gave some privacy while still having the kids right there. The location was great although we didn't walk much as the weather was quite cold. The staff were wonderful and very accepting of the kids. The hot chocolate machine in the lobby makes this one of my kids favorite hotels in the world!! Great overall experience!
reviews.title: Loved this boutique hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Previous reviews have already stated all the nice things about this hotel, so I won't repeat them. I will just back them up by saying that the Estherea is a GREAT hotel! Super-friendly staff, unbeatable central location, nice extra touches, sparkling clean rooms. I cannot recommend it highly enough.
reviews.title: Above and Beyond Expectations

likes.liked: — Coffee, snacks 24 hrs. a day, location, staff, clean modern room
likes.disliked: — I wish I could have stayed longer!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Father/ son from Texas stayed for two nights in May. It was the perfect place to stay to visit this wonderful city. Room on fifth floor with canal view. Common areas very pretty and comfortable, Staff right on and helpful. Close to most attractions. Highly recommend.. This hotel deserves it's high rating on Trip Advisor.
reviews.title: Great Place to get a Great Feel for Amsterdam

reviews.text: Stayed here for the weekend, spotlessly clean throughout, bedroom in excellent condition - wonderfully comfortable bed. Staff efficient. Nice touch to have the complimentary hot drinks available 24 hours in the foyet. Lovely frontage of hotel, everything in walking distance, good breakfast. Overall a nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Classic Elegance

likes.liked: — Spotlessly Clean and in good decorative order.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an amazing hotel. We had a deluxe double with canal view and four poster bed. It was very romantic and beautiful. The staff were all friendly. The best thing was the complimentary tea, hot choc and cakes in reception which you could have when ever you wanted without feeling you were being watched. We took it up to our room which was good too. The hotel was very comfortable to be in with a relaxed atmosphere. The location was the best and was central to everything. I would recommend this hotel and would stay again without hesitation.
reviews.title: brilliant hotel

likes.liked: — relaxed atmosphere. complimentary coffee and cakes and room decor
likes.disliked: — room service breakfast did not include bacon and eggs only continental

reviews.text: Hotel Estherea is a fabulous hotel and quite accomodating as well. We just returned from our travels which including this hotel and loved everything about it. Clean, wonderfully helpful and pleasant front desk staff and exceptionally large room for European standards. Easily accomodated me and two kids with lots of room to spare. Coffee, tea, hot chocolate and cookies are always available to guests...a huge perk for a quick snack since Europe is so expensive these days for American travelers...a coffee break anywhere in Europe can easily run $15-$20.00 these days. Fruit is usually also left for guests as well as small cakes if they are left over from the restaurant. The hotel has a wonderfully comfortable lobby as well. Without doubt I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Beautiful, charming and accomodating

likes.liked: — clean, comfortable and unusually large room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location - just around the corner from lovely restaurants and bars but still quiet.
reviews.title: Great Location, Quiet

reviews.text: I found the price expensive but then all hotels seem to be expensive in Amsterdam. We paid 220Euro for a Friday and Saturday night in July.
reviews.title: Great Stay!!! Loved The Estherea!

reviews.text: Rooms are small but adaquate and very clean. The bed was comfortable, the towels were fluffy.
reviews.title: Decent
Charming Respite in the Heart of a Great City
reviews.text: We did not eat at the hotel so I can make no comment on the menu. However, they do have good coffee in the lobby, small pastries and toffees. A nice addition.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel on a beautiful October Saturday in 2006.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel, great location, tiny and noisy rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good: the location is perfect. It's right near all the tourist attractions, on a beautiful canal on a relatively quiet street. The hotel staff was polite (though not very warm and friendly) and helpful with directions. The entree, the lobby, the rooms (see photo), hallways and the restaurant areas are very well and tastefully decorated. It's classy from the outside (see photo) and from the inside. Everything is very clean. The price for breakfast (14 euros) is not expensive. Complementary hot chocolate, coffee and tea is available 24 hours a day in the lobby.
reviews.title: Perfect Place to Stay in Amsterdam!

likes.liked: — Quiet location, special touches like chilled mint water and coffee 24x7

reviews.text: The shower was powerful and fully made up for the small bath you had to stand in to enjoy it.
reviews.title: we will return

reviews.text: The bad: we were placed in a tiny (see photo) 'normal' double room (but with a great view of the canal, see photo). They did say that if the room was too small, we could switch and this was one of the smallest room in the hotel. We only spend there one night, so with little luggage it was ok for one night. We would not have stayed in that room for any longer. The bathroom was tiny too. There was not enough room for two people. There wasn't even enough room for one! Another bad thing was the noise. We could hear the people above us walking around in their room, we could hear the slamming of closet doors from our neighbors and all the noise from the hallways. Also we couldn't seem to get the heater down, the temperature was centrally controlled. It caused the room to be way too warm and the air to be as dry as the air in airplanes. Our eyes even hurt a bit! So we slept with the window open. But the window did cause the street sounds to come in. Even though this is a relatively quiet street in Amsterdam, there is really no such thing as a quiet street in Amsterdam. We ended up sleeping very little hours.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel

likes.liked: — The great lobby and coffee machine
likes.disliked: — The steps at the entrance make it difficult with a stroller.

reviews.text: Breakfast was good, but nothing special. They run out of fresh fruit and the boiled eggs were disgusting.
reviews.title: Nice, but very cramped

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here during the Summer with my girlfriend, fantastic hotel in a beautiful part of Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Lekker!

reviews.text: Very friendly and helpful staff and the hotel and rooms were of a very high standard.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel - one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in

reviews.text: I've been to Amsterdam a number of times and stayed in some over priced, rubbish hotels and decided I'd pay that bit more for this visit and it was well worth it.
reviews.title: WOW!

reviews.text: The hotel is in a relatively quiet canal in Amsterdam so perfect if you want to avoid the main Red-light, (although there are a few discrete red-lights dotted along Singel), but still close enough to the centre if you get bored and want to explore the fun parts of the dam ;)
reviews.title: Great location, nice hotel - but double check your GPS

reviews.text: Booked last minute trip to Amsterdam and went over on the Ferry from Newcastle. Hotel was wonderful and made the trip. It was a short walk - 10 minutes if that - from the Central Station. We booked a triple room and a twin room and they were both beautiful. The Hotel is a beautiful hotel, feels very boutique. Breakfast was 18 euros each but only paid for people over 12, so 2 of the kids ate free which was great value. It was immaculate and the staff were fantastic, very friendly and helpful. Amsterdam was lovely - we were only there for 24 hours - did coach and horse ride from Dam Sq which was a great way to see the City, went on the canal bikes which were a great way to do the Canals, nicer than the proper tours. Our Lord in the Attic was good - Hidden church in the attic. We climbed the Westerkerk Tower which was a great view of Amsterdam. Hard Rock Cafe was fab. Didn't get to see Anne Frank Museum as hadn't booked - queues are long - book in advance on line if you want to go.
reviews.title: Beyond all best expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights, had read a lot of the other reviews and wandered if it would be as good as they said and it was. Hotel is very central and staff very helpful, would definetly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Execellent hotel

likes.liked: — Its central location and the room was very comfortable and the free tea/coffee/cakes very good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are just back from 4 nights at the Hotel Estherea. It is an outstanding hotel. It is beautifully decorated and extremely well run. The hotel staff is very helpful. Some of them might be a little formal, but all tried their best to help us in any way they could, from getting dining reservations to having a room for us when we arrived at 7 am - amazing! The location was unbeatable - no matter where we wanted to go in the city, it was an easy walk. We finally took the tram the last night, just for the experience. We had a double without the canal view, but it was very spacious. The bathroom, though small, was both spotless, and well equipped. The price was very fair. Even with the sad state of the dollar, it average the same as a recent stay at the San Diego Embassy Suites.
reviews.title: An excellent hotel, & I am fussy!

reviews.text: I can't thank all the reviewers enough for all the great information that they have given in their reviews. They helped make our trip go smoothly. From needing our credit card pin number to get the train tickets from the airport to finding the Gollum - a neat brown cafe -your advice was invaluable. I strongly recommend reading all the reviews you can- I felt so comfortable choosing restaurants and finding places - like the advice from about 25 close friends!
reviews.title: A Real Gem

likes.disliked: — The Window Was Always Left Opened By The Cleaners So On Our Return Room Was Very Cold

reviews.title: canal view
reviews.text: Don't hesitate trying the Luden - just around the block. The food was terrific, reasonably priced, especially in the Brasserie in the front,and felt like being in Paris. The Cafe Luxembourg was also fun, and just a little further down the street. The soups and fries were especially good. The hotel's location near so many great restaurants is just icing on the cake. We tried the hotel breakfast, and it was very good, but also crowded because they were full while we were there. So we only ate there once. Broodje Bert on the corner serves a bargain full breakfast or just a roll if you want, simple but fun to sit down and watch the world go by in front of you while sipping your coffee.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, we had a wonderful time. The weather was cold and rainy - it even snowed. But it didn't matter, we had such a good time in Amsterdam - we recommend it highly- and everyone spoke English!
reviews.title: A Beautiful place youll never want to leave!

likes.disliked: — Bed was far too comfy and I looked forward to getting back after our day out!

reviews.title: Great hotel, even with kids
reviews.text: With kids aged 9, 7 and 4, finding the right hotel with inter-connecting or adjacent rooms is vital. Despite having been promised this, the rooms we were given were separated by an internal courtyard and some distance apart, albeit neighbouring.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next day, we were offered alternative rooms which were right next to each other and from this moment on, we had a fantastic stay. The hotel was excellent with really friendly staff who used their initiative and for whom nothing was any trouble.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel- shame about the building work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were very good, well-equipped and very attractive. Worth getting rooms with a view if you can, not on the internal courtyard so you have natural light.
reviews.title: Helpful staff

likes.disliked: — workmen starting work at 7.30 am on monday morning !

reviews.text: Breakfast was not cheap at 14 euros each, but it was good and free for children under 12.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great with good access to tourist attractions and a variety of good local restaurants.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.text: I went to Amsterdam for the first time with my spouse last weekend. We stayed at the Estheria for 2 nights in a deluxe room (room #114).
reviews.title: Non smokers beware!

reviews.text: At first we were very satisfied by the hotel because it is beautiful, our room was large, clean, well decorated, and had a nice view on the canal, and the staff made a good impression on us.
reviews.title: 17th century canalhouse charm

reviews.text: The first problem arose on the first night: our room was on the first floor and we were disturbed around 1a.m by a group of people talking loudly right under our windows, probably waiting for some friends on the doorstep of the hotel. Apparently, nothing special has been done for (external)noise insulation. However it only last 15 minutes and thus was a minor problem. Note that we could not hear any noise coming from other rooms.
reviews.title: Fabulous
Great Location.
reviews.text: The second problem was of much greater importance. We asked for a non-smoking room, as usual, because we are, though french, very sensitive (negatively) to cigarette smoke. The room was indeed non-smoking, and nobody had smoked in our room, but the room in front of ours (room #115) was a smoking room. And the guests in room #115, in their right, were unfortunately smoking a lot. Our room was invaded by smoke all night and we had to sleep with an open window in spite of the outside temperature (I would say around -5 °C). At the reception, after checking the corridor, they admitted that there was indeed a lot of smoke but could not do anything because room #115 was a smoking room and the hotel was full (so that they could not give us another room).
We thus spent a terrible second night in that hotel.
reviews.title: Delightful place to stay

reviews.text: My mother and I have just come back from Amsterdam and I chose to stay at this hotel due to the great feedback I had found on Tripadvisor.
reviews.title: A Must

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say the hotel was superb!!! The check in staff very helpful and friendly, the decor very welcoming, the rooms were smallish but so beautifully and tastefull decorated, we really couldnt have wanted anything more. The bathrooms were very clean and the beds very comfortable. A real bonus was also the free afternoon cakes/ coffee for guests.
reviews.title: Best choice in Amsterdam if you're like me

likes.liked: — location, location, location- you want to feel safe. even the smallest amount of bad energy in hotel neighborhood can dampen your spirits
likes.disliked: — the front desk staff was just a bit smug and not several times know where things were nor could answer simple questions

reviews.text: We had a brilliant stay and will do so again!!
reviews.title: Tiny Shabby Room

reviews.text: If you're like me you want to stay right near everything happening, but have quiet for a restful retreat.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're like me you want to fully experience the location you are in by making your home one of architectural ambiance unique to the area, while not forgiving luxury, comfort and class.
reviews.title: Not Your Average European Hotel

likes.disliked: — The fairly pricey breakfast and wireless internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect central location on a beautiful canal, a short walk to many restaurants and attractions and right near a tram to take you quickly everywhere else. Wonderful, courteous staff. Gorgeous old-Amsterdam style canal house hotel. The public areas are drop-dead gorgeous and there are now two computers in the living room for guests without charge -- one or the other was always available.. Tea, coffee, cookies etc. left out all day are a nice touch and we appreciated a cup of camomile tea while watching the fish in the fish tank. Our room was quiet (on an interior courtyard), very charming -- comfortable bed and large bath with a nice tub/shower and nice toiletries.. This was my second stay at the Estherea, and I'd love to go back anytime!
reviews.title: My Favorite Hotel In The World!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Estherea is in a good location on the Singel Canal. The description states that it has been held in ownership by the same family for many,many generations. That made us believe that all the personal touches and pride of family ownership would be there. Instead, the reception was aloof to the point of being unhelpful--for example,the porter showed us to our room but he never carried our bags and saw me struggling with mine. He merely opened the door for us and expected his two euro tip! When I emailed the front desk to ask about the taxi charges from the train station to the hotel they told me about 10 euros. They didn't bother to mention that all the taxi drivers in Amsterdam cheat on the fares,which is common,common knowl;edge. What the drivers say is--"you have 4 bags. That costs extra!" If the hotel staff knew this, in my view they could have easily have said--BEWARE! We were charged 25 euros for a three minute ride. Apparently that was the highest they had heard of from other complaints issued by hotel guests. When we asked about restaurant recommendations they only came up with one name--we indicated that we were just there--could there be another restaurant in all of Amsterdam.They indicated they couldn't think of one but would get back to us. They never did. Having said all that, I will now state that the location is good and central.quiet,
reviews.title: Mediocre--At Best

reviews.text: We stayed in a triple room for 3 nights our bed was a super kingsize with lovely bedlinen. Our daughter slept in a proper sturdy sofa bed which was also very comfortable. The room was cleaned everyday with bottles of mineral water replaced in the minibar free of charge. There was a very high standard of cleanliness throughout the hotel which we loved. Lots of lovely complementary toiletries, slippers and a proper iron and ironing board. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, we ate in the local cafe called broodje bert which was delicious, we also had eggs benedict one morning at Cafe Luxembourg which was also verg good. The free tea, coffee,hot chocolate was such a nice touch, we looked forward to coming back to the hotel late afternoon for a cuppa and some cakes and cookies. Our daughter loved the jars of free sweets and candies that were also on offer. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel also had free internet access which is very unusual, great for checking in online and printing off tickets. The hotel is very central it's near to Dam square, it's within walking distance of Anne Franks house, the canal boats, the museums and Vondel park, we walked everywhere with a 5 year old. This is not a cheap hotel but you get what you pay for and I honestly can't say anything negative about this hotel. I find it hard to believe that some people have had a bad experience staying here. We'll be back at some point in the future.
reviews.title: Very well furnished and extremely comfortable central hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have never been so delighted by a hotel in my long traveling life. Hotel Estherea is right on the Singel Canal and many rooms face onto the canal (though the ones on the 5th floor only have one window, the ones below have huge picture windows). The hotel lobby is just delightful and beautiful and quiet most of the time. This boutique hotel is near some great restaurants, and it is perfectly located. We asked to hold our bags several times, and the front desk staff was amazingly helpful and kind. I wish there were a hotel like this in every European city. It is a real find, and I would never stay anywhere in Amsterdam again. (DO NOT go to the American Hotel, despite its reputation -- SO touristy). This is a charmer! (Oh, and you'll love the gorgeous salt water fish tank in the lobby -- tres elegante!).
reviews.title: Beautiful Boutique Hotel, Amazing Service, Lovely Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was excelent and very helpful with any questions that we had. We spent 2 nights there and it was much better then the 5 star hotel we stayed in on the way back to Paris in Brussels. We found out the hard way via cab rides that the best way to get anywhere in Amsterdam is either the canel hop on hop off boat., or simply when you go out the front door of the hotel go right and the first cross street make another right and walk a few blocks to the center of the city. No need for fancy places to eat as any small pub will do and the food is just as good.
reviews.title: Great staff very helpful, good location, worth the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights here about 10 days ago.
reviews.title: Great location, lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was available straight away when we arrived which was great and it looked over the canal. The staff were vey courteous and helpful though unfortunately this did not last.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tea, coffee and cake were complimentary of an afternoon and evening which was a quality touch and rare in most hotels. We found the common areas really comfortable and homely. These ares were great after dinner, reading or just relaxing as the rooms are quite small.
reviews.title: cultrual city break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon asking staff on our second day at reception for information about various things to do and see, restaurants etc. they really were not that helpful or interested which was a shame. I will say though that there was one young guy who took our bags and he was delightful and informative.
reviews.title: Rooms are nice, staff is rude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is so much to do and see in Amsterdam and walking around is the best way to see all. The food and restaurants are great and to us, very reasonably priced. We went out for breakfast each morning and it was 1/4 price of the hotel. It was unfortunate that it rained alot as we would have done so much more.
reviews.title: Always Estherea!

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Estherea for our 20th wedding anniversary. On arrival we got a lovely warm welcome and a surprise basket of celebratory freebies in our room. The view from our window was of one of Amsterdam's numerous canals, very picturesque!
reviews.title: Happy Anniversary

reviews.text: Our room was clean, nicely decorated and really only lacked tea and coffee making facilities. Mind you all we had to do was take up the complimentary coffee from the lobby up to our room!
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel, great location!

reviews.text: The hotel itself is very inviting, lots of dark wood, old books and leather sofas. The staff were always friendly and courteous, always willing to help and answer questions.
reviews.title: Worth every euro

reviews.text: Amsterdam is a fantastic city to explore and the Estherea's location is ideal for getting to all the sights.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: All in all we had a fantastic time...do visit Anne Franks' house and do eat in the little cafe bar "De Prins" opposite the house on the other side of the canal....brilliant food, nice vibe and cheap!
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent Christmas at Hotel estherea - chosen thanks to the many good reviews it was given. Our fifth trip to Amsterdam and the best hotel we've been to. Arriving in ( after trecking round shops and bars) to the 24hr tea/coffee/hot choc machine was heaven (no kettles to boil)! There was even iced-water with fresh mint!
reviews.title: Wow - Christmas at Estherea; the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Public rooms very cosy and Christmas decorations very tasteful. (Bowls of chocolates on various tables)Friendly, helpful staff. Breakfast is optional - well worth the 14 Euros - especially the sausages and the muffins!
reviews.title: EXCELLENT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room overlooked canal ; was a great size and tastefully decorated (antique writing desk!)
reviews.title: loved Estherea

likes.liked: — The extras like drinks and snacks on tap and lovely lounges to relax in 3 in total inc. bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'll definitely return.

reviews.text: Selecting a hotel in Amsterdam was very difficult, as there were so many mixed reviews. I finally picked this one as the negative comments were minimal and it had air conditioning, and we did need it! This hotel was located along the relatively quiet Singel canal. As we ventured out toward the Dam Square and the pedestrian shopping street, we really began to appreciate the location. We were within walking distance of everything but away from all the congestion of people, bikes, trams and autos. The hotel was very nice, with elegant and formal decor, and big tasseled room keys. The bed was very comfy and the linens very luxorious. We had large windows overlooking the canal and street. The bathroom was small but nice, and the toiletries supplied were impressive. The hotel doesn't look like much from the outside, but it is housed in several centuries old buildings, with all the ambiance you'd want in an Amsterdam hotel. The hotel was a bit pricey, but after seeing some of the other hotels we had considered online, we were glad we'd paid the extra money for this one. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as there were several pastry shops in the vicinity where we were able to but meat pies and beverages for about 8 euros.

reviews.text: My wife and I and our 9 year old son have just returned from a very enjoyable stay at this wonderful hotel.The staff were very professional and courteous, and dealt with any requests swiftly. At the same time the immediate area is fairly quiet, so you have the best of both worlds. The free tea, coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby are a nice touch, as is the library.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Estherea for 3 nights in mid July. We loved the hotel, great rooms - with the most comfy beds ever! It was tough to get out of bed in the morning! The bathroom was lovely with a big walk in shower, double sinks and a big jacuzzi. In the lobby guests are provided with free hots drinks and a selection of biscuits, which were delicious. The fish tank in the lobby is great, lots of lovely sea life to watch. The staff were all lovely and very helpful. We didnt bother with breakfast at the hotel, we chose to eat out, there are plenty of places close by to grab a nice breakfast - Cafe Luxembourg does nice omlettes! There is also a bakery in the alley beside the hotel and it is practically impossilbe to walk by and ignore the smell of delicious things cooking! Esthera is in a great location, its on the Singel canal, which is beautiful, and is within easy walking distance of all the main attractions. It takes around 20 minutes to walk to central station, and its a nice walk. Its also really close to one of Amsterdams best restaurants - The Five Flies http://www.thefiveflies.com/nl/index.asp? - a must if you stay here! Another great place also located really close is Ludens http://www.luden.nl/2/Amsterdam/default.ecms. We also had lunch at the Dylan in the courtyard, it was lovely too and on a warm sunny day it was great relaxing in the court yard http://www.dylanamsterdam.com/ We treated ourselves to dinner at Ciel Bleu http://www.cielbleu.nl/en/Home.html Its expensive but the food & the views were amazing. The food presentation was stunning, we didnt know if we were supposed to eat it or wear it! Another place worth checking out is the Grasshopper, coffee shop, bar and steak house all in one building. The terrace outside was beautiful and a great place to relax and soak up the sun http://www.thegrasshopper.nl/.

description: Located in the heart of the city, Hotel Estherea is housed in a row of historic buildings on the major canal. Behind the 17th century façade, guests find a warm welcome in comfortable surroundings. With its woolen carpets, crystal chandeliers and sumptuous furniture, the hotel is an oasis of tranquility in the middle of the bustling city.The Estherea first opened its doors in the 1940s. this family business is currently run by the third generation. Although the hotel’s comforts and facilities have been brought up to date over the past sixty years, the concept of personal service and attention remains unchanged. All 92 rooms have been recently renovated and are all accessible by elevator. Each room has its own unique character: a wonderful place to unwind a day of exploring the city.
